page.title: 17RODNEY STOKE NATURE RESERVE
page.content: Stoke Woods are located on the S.W. slope overlooking Rodney Stoke and the Somerset levels. Because these woods are rich in both flora and fauna they were declared as a National Nature Reserve in{1957.}The total area of the Reserve is 35 hectares and it is owned by the Nature Conservancy Council. The Reserve consists of two wooded spurs with a small dry valley between. The woods used to be coppiced but were mostly felled during the 1914-18 war and West Wood was again felled during the 1939-45 period. Hence the trees in West Wood are younger than those in East Wood. Temperature extremes are{-7'C}to{30'C and annual average rainfall is about {1000}millimetres. Permits are required to enter this Reserve.
